intro: Bulbocodium flavum, commonly known as the yellow bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
